review: Fire TV Stick totally met my expectations! We were very frustrated by the fact that we were paying for Amazon Prime but unable to access the free movies/TV shows because our TV's were not compatible (too old) with the newer technology.  Fire TV Stick to the rescue!  It makes every TV with the proper plug-in feature compatible and the installation/set-up was simple, too.  Now we can enjoy the full spectrum of what Amazon Prime has to offer and then some.
author: STEVE J CLAYTON

review: After the 2nd one developed the same glitchy functionality within days of replacement I'd have to say there are more than just a few software related bugs and perhaps some hardware related limitations.Having smart tv's and smart devices already, the Amazon account integration for auto sync to see content from my account that was synced from my phone made the idea worth while to order. At the promotional price it was a no brainer. In practice the extra RAM still wasn't enough.It is still a far stronger experience than an EZ-Cast device but not the top flight experience I was expecting.Started out good and then crumbled in video and responsiveness. Nice interface and solid integration but doesn't handle the personal content demands for photo and video to the point where those impede the quality of the rest of the services.I can't say for certain that it is the 43,000 plus photos and videos that I've cached through or the circuitry not holding up.It had minor hesitations from the beginning that got more frequent and freezing up for longer periods. Network tests on my home wireless and service provider showed now issues.YMMV.
author: J. Silberman "jsmail951"
